result.execSummary:
The defendant Jorge Manuel Soto-Ortiz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Attorney Awni M Yasin in court, defendant Jorge Manuel Soto-Ortiz not in court, in custody.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Defendant in custody not produced, appearance waived.  Case calendared for restitution hearing.  State reports that they have not been able to acquire additional information or documentation from witness, Julio C-R.  Defense requests Court set restitution at zero for this victim.  Court granted the defense motion and ordered restitution as to Julio C-R set at ZERO.

Attorney Awni M Yasin in court, defendant Jorge Manuel Soto-Ortiz not in court, in custody.  May Y. Lee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Defendant in custody not produced, appearance waived.  State needs to gather additional documentation regarding restitution.  For reasons stated on the record, Court ordered case adjourned for restitution hearing in Branch 31.  Restitution document, received and filed.  Restitution hearing scheduled for August 30, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Sworn as interpreter: Enrique Barbosa.

Defendant Jorge Manuel Soto-Ortiz in court with attorney Awni M Yasin.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Case calendared for sentencing hearing.  State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the state, defense and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 2: Defendant sentenced to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, with credit for 1 day time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 1 year.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 90 days in the House of Correction, with Huber release for work and treatment. Defendant is to report by 8/12/16 at 5:00 pm.
- Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
- Only incidental contact with the victims, Julio C-R. and Jerome L.
- Pay all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges during the period of probation, cash bail to apply.  Any remaining balance at the end of probation is due immediately or entry of a civil judgment.
- Restitution is set at $728.00, payable to Jerome L. during the period of probation, cash bail to apply.  Any remaining balance at the end of probation is due immediately or entry of a civil judgment.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Rights;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Sentencing Referral Form;
Letters on behalf of defendant.

Court ordered case adjourned for restitution hearing as to victim, Julio C-R., in Branch 31.  Restitution hearing scheduled for August 19, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Sworn as interpreter:  Brenda Bartholomew.

Defendant Jorge Manuel Soto-Ortiz in court with attorney Awni M Yasin.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.

AS TO COUNT 1:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered count dismissed and read-in.

AS TO COUNT 2:  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 4.  All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2016 this case will be assigned to Judge Hannah Dugan - Branch 31 in Room 622 - Courthouse.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 2, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jorge Manuel Soto-Ortiz in court with attorney Awni M Yasin.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defense counsel waives the appearance of the interpreter for this hearing only.  Defense requested a final pretrial and jury trial date in Branch 4.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 30, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for July 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jorge Manuel Soto-Ortiz in court with attorney Awni M Yasin.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Judge Hanrahan, Branch 4 is in trial.  Defense counsel has not yet obtained discovery from prior counsel.  Court ordered case adjourned for pretrial conference in Branch 4.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 5, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Ruth Garcia appeared in court.

Defendant Jorge Manuel Soto-Ortiz in court with attorney Awni M Yasin.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defense counsel waives the appearance of an interpreter for this hearing.  Defense counsel has not yet received discovery.  Court ordered case adjourned for pretrial conference in Branch 4.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 19, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on March 28, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Cynthia Rosa Herber in court.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defense advised the court that she has had no contact with the defendant.  Defense counsel has sent letters in english/spanish to the defendant's last known address and made attempts to contact him by phone.  For reasons stated on the record, Court grants defense motion to withdraw as counsel.  Court orders the jury trial date vacated.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 4.  Status conference scheduled for March 28, 2016 at 08:30 am.
MOTION TO WITHDRAW AS ATTORNEY OF RECORD, FILED

Defendant Jorge Manuel Soto-Ortiz in court with attorney Cynthia Herber.  Defendant Jorge Manuel Soto-Ortiz in custody.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case calendared for status conference. Parties proceeded to plea/sentencing. Pursuant to plea negotiations, the court was asked to dismiss, but read-in count 1. However, court found that there was not enough basis for the read-in and ordered the case adjourned in branch 24. 
  Jury trial scheduled for December 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Cynthia Herber in court, defendant Jorge Manuel Soto-Ortiz not in court, in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  The State has not yet provided defense with discovery or offer.  Court orders case dismissed over objection of defense.  Defense checked and found that she does have discovery.  Court reconsiders and orders the State to present defense with an offer within 48 hours.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 24.  Status conference scheduled for September 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Sworn as interpreter:  Ruth Garcia.
